description: Newcastle disease (ND) is one of the most devastating avian diseases that significantly affect the global poultry industry. It is included among the list of diseases that require immediate notification to OIE upon recognition. The pathogen of the disease is Newcastle disease virus (NDV), a negative stranded RNA virus whose genome houses six genes, namely, nucleocapsid protein (NP), phosphoprotein (P), matrix protein (M), fusion protein (F), hemagglutinin-neuraminidase protein (HN), and the large protein (L).
name: Newcastle Disease Virus Antibodies and Antigens
